comments.body: There is a conflict between the license named in the `setup.py` (GPL) and in the actual license file in the repo (Apache-2.0). Let's figure out which is correct and include the `license_file` in the recipe.

I believe the difference stems from the fact that there hasn't been a new release since the license changed. See [this issue](https://github.com/daleroberts/hdmedians/issues/1) where the maintainer kindly agreed to change the license. I've submitted [a PR](https://github.com/daleroberts/hdmedians/pull/3/files) to fix the setup.py.
Ok, but you still need to distribute the Apache license
Thanks, for now I've left GPL3 and included the corresponding license file. I'll update this to Apache once there's a new release of hdmedians.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +33,37 @@about:
  home: http://github.com/daleroberts/hdmedians
  license: GPL3
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file: '{{ environ["RECIPE_DIR"] }}/LICENSE'

comments.body: Since this is GPL'd you need to include the `license_file` entry here.  If the license does not come in the tarball, feel free to stick a copy of it in the recipe: https://conda-forge.org/docs/meta.html#packaging-the-license-manually

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +34,38 @@  home: http://github.com/daleroberts/hdmedians
  license: GPL3
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file: '{{ environ["RECIPE_DIR"] }}/LICENSE'
  summary: High-dimensional medians
